data.title: html block comment problem in php file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create an php file
2. type some html and try to comment using ctrl+/ <- single line,
   alt+shift+a <- block level (this is better to be default shortcut of ctrl+shift+/ used for all famous text editor so i had changed)
3. you will see html comment are not working there, without <?php ?> syntax getting php comments in html

data.title: VSCODE with ext PowerShell 0.7.0 - Throws errors and fails...
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:

On Windows 7 workstation with latest SP etc.
1. Download VSCODE and do a fresh install; 
   1.1 This also happens for me as a result of an upgrade of the PowerShell extension to Version 0.7.0; Basically I have tried this on two different workstations;
2. Install the **[vscode.PowerShell](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.PowerShell) Version 0.7.0**
3. Open PowerShell file and you should observe the errors reported in the UI:

> **Error  Could not start language service: undefined**
> 
> **Error  Couldn't start client PowerShell Editor Services**

Please note I have also tried uninstalling both VSCODE and the extension multiple times and cleaned %AppData% etc. without any success.

I was successfully running VSCODE with previous version of PowerShell extension 6.x.x and the error condition occurred after upgrade to PowerShell 0.7.0

**HELP:** Meanwhile any tips how to obtain and run the older PowerShell extension will be greatly appreciated as I have lost my PowerShell DEV environment as VSCODE was my editor of choice :)

data.title: Only 'git fetch' if there is a remote repository available
data.body:
Working on #8053 

Update the AutoFetcher loop to check the gitServer.model.remotes before doing a 'git fetch'.  Only fetch if there is a remote listed in the model.

data.title: Add command-line option for updating.
data.body:
Now that the insider's are getting _nightly_ new builds, we need a way to trigger the download and install **before** opening the editor, so we don't have to open it, and then wait for it to fetch the update, and then restart again... every morning.

Ideally, a command-line option, or just a separate helper script, which could take care of fetching and starting the update install. Then we could (optionally) create a shortcut that would check for and install any updates _before_ starting the editor.

data.title: Extended glob patter for findFiles

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It seems that `vscod.workspace.findFiles` doesn't support extended patterns such as:

`**/+(gulpfile.js|package.json)` or `'**/@(node_modules|jspm_packages|bower_components)/**'`

http://www.linuxjournal.com/content/bash-extended-globbing

it is quite limiting.

data.title: Hang, requiring restart

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Version 1.4.0
Commit 6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679
Date 2016-08-04T16:49:32.489Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
Linux ubuntu 4.4.0-34-generic #53-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jul 27 16:06:39 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VSCode
2. Code for a while ( 30 - 90 minutes )
3. The UI will freeze and vs code will need to be restarted. Only affects the current editor window, so if there is more than one project open the one not in use is not affected.

I wish I could provide more helpful feedback, but there is no consistent cause for this.

data.title: [File Hierarchy] Old selection not removed upon new selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

I am not sure what caused this, but once in awhile I have multiple items selected, even though one of the items is not selected. Somehow it isn't clearing the old selection when a new selection is selected.

Here is an example:

![multiple-select](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1571806/17899874/76a02cda-6922-11e6-9be8-6e298b7ab4a9.PNG)

data.title: Feature Request : Edit last commit message
data.body:
I like the built-in Git support in Code, but I often need to switch back to SmartGit and the CLI for a specific feature: the ability to quickly edit the last commit message (unless already pushed), in one step.

Alternatively, it would be nice if undoing the last commit restored the commit message in the message field. It's almost the same feature, when you think about it. Might be a simple way to implement a first iteration of the feature.

data.title: Add a setting to prevent explorer to open last opened file when getting visible

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0 - insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

This behavior would be normal? In certain moments it can become annoying.

It can happen in other situations my was as follows.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder other folders and files inside.
2. Click on a file that does not get the Preview Editor.
3. Open User Setting.Deixe the mouse cursor on the "Default Setting".
4. Hide the Explorer (sidebar). Stay on the "Default Setting".
5. Now click to redisplay the Explorer (sidebar).
6. The same file back to the guide mentioned in number 2.

Another situation:
1. Open a folder other folders and files inside.
2. Click on a file that does not get the Preview Editor.
3. Open User Setting.Deixe the mouse cursor on the "Default Setting".
4. Choose another file to visualiar (either in the Preview Editor mode or not).
5. Hide the Explorer (sidebar).
6. Close the item guide 4.
7. Now click to redisplay the Explorer (sidebar).
8. The same file back to the guide mentioned in number 4.

Being in the second group of guides (ie keeping the pointer mouse before in "settings.json") the problem does not happen. In the first group created guides (which comes standard).

I think this should not happen. The same could keep a color on the last file that was seen (or a different color tone that exists), as at present, but without reopening it.

Or have a specific configuration for that not to happen?

data.title: Search returns no results
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open source directory
2. Click search charm (top left) and enter simple text
3. Progress bar indicates a search is in progress
4. No results.
5. I open a source file that I know has the text and search within the file and find multiple occurrences of the same text.

data.title: [css] support `contain` property in css
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.40
- OS Version: 10.11.6 (15G31)

The css [`contain` property](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-containment/) is not properly recognized in VScode. Should be
`contain: none | strict | content | [ size || layout || style || paint ]`

data.title: Debugger is not displaying correctly a decimal property value
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6
- .NET core version: 1.0.0-preview2-003121

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a class with a decimal property
2. Create a test and set any value to the decimal property
3. Put a breakpoint after changing the decimal property
4. Debug
5. Inspect the decimal property value from the class

As you can see in the screenshot, the debugger is not working correctly. It's is showing an invalid number.

The issue is only related to the debugger since the value is being correctly set.

![vscodeerror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/911493/17892153/259207be-6940-11e6-9c30-306c011b2dd9.png)

data.title: Ctrl+C doesn't clear the line in integrated cmd.exe

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a Terminal
2. Type something, then press Ctrl+C

Expected result: you get a new empty line as you would in a standalone `cmd.exe` window.
Actual: nothing happens.

Note: it seems Ctrl+C works as expected for interrupting a process.

data.title: Fix sending message to terminated worker
data.body:
The problem appears if you create multiple editors/models and then change the typescript compilation settings. This will dispose (terminate) the worker as first action. then it will dispose all existing models which will try to send messages for "acceptRemovedModel" to the worker(s) but as they are already terminated this will result in error.

I'm not sure if it is a better if the worker is terminated to reject the postMessage request immediately since this will again result in error.

data.body:

Source:
\n\t\t\t\t\t\tArgument Properties:\n\t\t\t\t\t\t'to': String value providing where to move.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t'by': String value providing the unit for move. By tab or by group.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t'value': Number value providing how many positions or an absolute position to move.\n\t\t\t\t\t

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\browser\parts\editor\editorCommands.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "editorCommand.activeEditorMove.arg.description"

Query:
Could you clarify the meaning of "tab" here?  
(es)
